spartann.classifier package

Submodules

spartann.classifier.classifier module

class spartann.classifier.classifier.AnnClassifier(modelcontainer: ~spartann.classifier.model.ModelContainer, validation: ~typing.Callable = <spartann.classifier.validation.Validation object>)[source]

Bases: object

The AnnClassifier provides methods for training a Artificial Neural Network with different parameters and optimizers for supervised classification.

classmethod from_datatable(dt: ~spartann.datatable.datatable.DataTable, repetitions: int = 20, testpercent: int = 20, hl_schemes: list | list[list] = [8, 4], LR: float = 0.01, momentum: float = 0.01, optim: str = 'Adam', validation: ~typing.Callable = <spartann.classifier.validation.Validation object>)[source]

Initiallise the classifier with a DataTable.

Parameters:

  • dt – A DataTable instance with data to train model.

  • repetitions – Number of repetitions performed per network scheme.

  • testpercent – percentage of points reserved for independent testing the training of the network (overfitting control).

  • hl_schemes – list of hidden layer network schemes to test. A network with 10 inputs and 2 hidden layers with 5 and 3 neurons, plus a single output layer is simply given as [5,3].

  • LR – Learning rate. Depending on the optimizer, might have different importance.

  • momentum – Decay factor for the optimizer. Note: the “Adam” optimizer need two decay factors given in a list [B1, B2] (usually [0.9, 0.999]). Other optimization methods need only a float.

  • optim – Optimization method. Available methods are “SGD” (stochastic gradient descend), “SimpleMomentum”, “Momentum”, “Adagrad”, “RMSProp” and “Adam”.

  • validation – Validation metric to be used, depending on the data. An instance of Validatio class.

classmethod from_options(inputs: list, outputs: list = ['Output1'], repetitions: int = 20, testpercent: int = 20, hl_schemes: list | list[list] = [8, 4], LR: float = 0.01, momentum: float = 0.01, optim: str = 'Adam', validation: ~typing.Callable = <spartann.classifier.validation.Validation object>)[source]

Initiallise the classifier with options with defaults.

Parameters:

  • n_inputs – Number of inputs neurons.

  • n_outputs – Number of ouput neurons (default is 1)

  • repetitions – Number of repetitions performed per network scheme.

  • testpercent – percentage of points reserved for independent testing the training of the network (overfitting control).

  • hl_schemes – list of hidden layer network schemes to test. A network with 10 inputs and 2 hidden layers with 5 and 3 neurons, plus a single output layer is simply given as [5,3].

  • LR – Learning rate. Depending on the optimizer, might have different importance.

  • momentum – Decay factor for the optimizer. Note: the “Adam” optimizer need two decay factors given in a list [B1, B2] (usually [0.9, 0.999]). Other optimization methods need only a float.

  • optim – Optimization method. Available methods are “SGD” (stochastic gradient descend), “SimpleMomentum”, “Momentum”, “Adagrad”, “RMSProp” and “Adam”.

  • validation – Validation metric to be used, depending on the data. An instance of Validatio class.

property getmodels

Returns a ModelContainer with trained models.

trainModel(datatable: DataTable | None = None, maxiter: int = 10000, stable: int = 250, stable_val: float = 0.001)[source]

Trains a model ensemble.

Uses information (data and classification) in a DataTable to train ANN with the user defined parameters.

Parameters:

  • datatable – A DataTable instance with points for supervised learning.

  • maxiter – Maximum number of iterations to train.

  • stable – number if iterations with error diference bellow stable_val to stop training early.

  • stable_val – value for the network error difference between to consider stable.

writeModel(filename: str)[source]

Writes the trained models to a file.

Parameters:

filename – the file name to be written, usually with .obj extension.

class spartann.classifier.classifier.AnnPredict(modelcontainer)[source]

Bases: object

Class for predicting based on trained models.

classmethod from_annclassifier(ann: AnnClassifier)[source]

Open models and predict from a AnnClassifier instance with trained networks.

Parameters:

ann – instace of AnnClassifier with trained models.

classmethod from_modelsfile(filename: str)[source]

Open models from file for prediction.

Parameters:

filename – the models file saved from an AnnClassifier instance. Usually .obj file.

predict(patterns: list, scale: bool = True) → list[source]

Predict output of model to a list of patterns.

Parameters:

  • patterns – a list with patterns to be tested with trained models. Patterns must follow the same order as in training.

  • scale – if patterns should be scaled with network stored means and standard deviations.

Returns:

a list of predictions with the format [[[output_1], [output_2]]] for all models trained.

predictFromDataTable(datatable: DataTable, scale: bool = True) → DataTable[source]

Predict values with data from a DataTable instance.

Uses the data slot of a DataTable to get values to predict.

Parameters:

  • datatable – a DataTable instance with data to test and predict. Must follow the same order as original data used to train models.

  • scale – If true, use network stored mean and standard deviations to scale data.

predictFromRaster(raster: Raster, scale: bool = True, multiplier: int = 1000, blocksize: int = 250, nodata: int | float = -9999, dtype: str = 'int16', ncores: int = 1) → Raster[source]

Predicts from a raster object used trained models.

The bands of the raster object are used as patterns and must be provided in the same order as original data used for training. Multicore processing is usefull for large rasters. It requires that the raster exists as a file (either loaded form file or written to one).

Parameters:

  • raster – an instance of a Raster object.

  • scale – If True, use means and standard deviation stored with the network to scale data.

  • multiplier – a multiplication factor for the predictions values

  • blocksize – the size of the blocks to predict (instead of using the whole raster array at once).

  • nodata – nodata value to be used in the new raster

  • dtype – the data type of the raster to be created

  • ncores – Number of cores/processes to be used for processing a raster

Returns:

A Raster object with predictions, where each band represents a trained network (repetitions and schemes). Check metadata.

spartann.classifier.validation module

spartann.classifier.validation.CohensKappa_Validation = <spartann.classifier.validation.Validation object>

Assess the performance of a binary classification model using Cohen’s Kappa.

This instantiation of the “Validation” class simplifies the evaluation process for the user. It is specifically designed for binary datasets and uses Cohen’s Kappa metric to measure agreement between predictions and calibration data.

Note: - The default threshold for classification is set to 0.5, meaning values

greater than or equal to 0.5 are classified as positive, and values below 0.5 are classified as negative.

spartann.classifier.validation.PearsonsCorr_Validation = <spartann.classifier.validation.Validation object>

Assess the performance of a continuous data using Pearson’s Correlation Score.

This instantiation of the “Validation” class simplifies the evaluation process for the user. It is specifically designed for continuous datasets and uses Pearson’s Correlation Score to measure agreement between predictions and calibration data.

class spartann.classifier.validation.Validation(func: Callable[[list, list], float], name: str, threshold: None | float = None)[source]

Bases: object

General class for providing validation metric to classifier.

calc(real: list[list], pred: list[list]) → float[source]

Calculate metric. Used by classifier.

spartann.classifier.validation.cohenkappa(real: list, pred: list) → float[source]

Cohen’s Kappa

Calculates Cohen’s Kappa from a list of real and predicted values.

Parameters:

  • real – a list of zeros and ones referring to binary targets.

  • pred – a list of same size of real with predicted binary values.

spartann.classifier.validation.pearsonscorr(real: list, pred: list) → float[source]

Pearson’s correlation

Calculates Pearson’s correlation from two list of continuous values.

Parameters:

  • real – the target values.

  • pred – the predicted values by the model.

Module contents

class spartann.classifier.AnnClassifier(modelcontainer: ~spartann.classifier.model.ModelContainer, validation: ~typing.Callable = <spartann.classifier.validation.Validation object>)[source]

Bases: object

The AnnClassifier provides methods for training a Artificial Neural Network with different parameters and optimizers for supervised classification.

classmethod from_datatable(dt: ~spartann.datatable.datatable.DataTable, repetitions: int = 20, testpercent: int = 20, hl_schemes: list | list[list] = [8, 4], LR: float = 0.01, momentum: float = 0.01, optim: str = 'Adam', validation: ~typing.Callable = <spartann.classifier.validation.Validation object>)[source]

Initiallise the classifier with a DataTable.

Parameters:

  • dt – A DataTable instance with data to train model.

  • repetitions – Number of repetitions performed per network scheme.

  • testpercent – percentage of points reserved for independent testing the training of the network (overfitting control).

  • hl_schemes – list of hidden layer network schemes to test. A network with 10 inputs and 2 hidden layers with 5 and 3 neurons, plus a single output layer is simply given as [5,3].

  • LR – Learning rate. Depending on the optimizer, might have different importance.

  • momentum – Decay factor for the optimizer. Note: the “Adam” optimizer need two decay factors given in a list [B1, B2] (usually [0.9, 0.999]). Other optimization methods need only a float.

  • optim – Optimization method. Available methods are “SGD” (stochastic gradient descend), “SimpleMomentum”, “Momentum”, “Adagrad”, “RMSProp” and “Adam”.

  • validation – Validation metric to be used, depending on the data. An instance of Validatio class.

classmethod from_options(inputs: list, outputs: list = ['Output1'], repetitions: int = 20, testpercent: int = 20, hl_schemes: list | list[list] = [8, 4], LR: float = 0.01, momentum: float = 0.01, optim: str = 'Adam', validation: ~typing.Callable = <spartann.classifier.validation.Validation object>)[source]

Initiallise the classifier with options with defaults.

Parameters:

  • n_inputs – Number of inputs neurons.

  • n_outputs – Number of ouput neurons (default is 1)

  • repetitions – Number of repetitions performed per network scheme.

  • testpercent – percentage of points reserved for independent testing the training of the network (overfitting control).

  • hl_schemes – list of hidden layer network schemes to test. A network with 10 inputs and 2 hidden layers with 5 and 3 neurons, plus a single output layer is simply given as [5,3].

  • LR – Learning rate. Depending on the optimizer, might have different importance.

  • momentum – Decay factor for the optimizer. Note: the “Adam” optimizer need two decay factors given in a list [B1, B2] (usually [0.9, 0.999]). Other optimization methods need only a float.

  • optim – Optimization method. Available methods are “SGD” (stochastic gradient descend), “SimpleMomentum”, “Momentum”, “Adagrad”, “RMSProp” and “Adam”.

  • validation – Validation metric to be used, depending on the data. An instance of Validatio class.

  • maxiter – Maximum number of iterations to train.

  • stable – number if iterations with error diference bellow stable_val to stop training early.

  • stable_val – value for the network error difference between to consider stable.

predictFromRaster(raster: Raster, scale: bool = True, multiplier: int = 1000, blocksize: int = 250, nodata: int | float = -9999, dtype: str = 'int16', ncores: int = 1) → Raster[source]

Predicts from a raster object used trained models.

The bands of the raster object are used as patterns and must be provided in the same order as original data used for training. Multicore processing is usefull for large rasters. It requires that the raster exists as a file (either loaded form file or written to one).

Parameters:

  • raster – an instance of a Raster object.

  • scale – If True, use means and standard deviation stored with the network to scale data.

  • multiplier – a multiplication factor for the predictions values

  • blocksize – the size of the blocks to predict (instead of using the whole raster array at once).

  • nodata – nodata value to be used in the new raster

  • dtype – the data type of the raster to be created

  • ncores – Number of cores/processes to be used for processing a raster

Returns:

A Raster object with predictions, where each band represents a trained network (repetitions and schemes). Check metadata.
